content: This section allows the Secretary, in consultation with the Director of National Intelligence, to designate any foreign government or regime as a foreign adversary if they find that the government or regime is engaged in a long-term pattern or serious instances of conduct significantly adverse to the national security of the United States or security and safety of US persons. The designation can be removed if the Secretary determines that the government or regime is no longer engaging in such conduct. The Secretary must notify certain congressional leaders and committees 15 days before making or removing a designation.
